intro: Prunella vulgaris f. leucocephala, commonly known as white-headed selfheal, is a variant of the common selfheal plant. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of small, white flowers with a distinctive blue-violet calyx. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
